desc.p: Exchange rate used in the conversion of the tax amount.
Tax code specifying the tax to be levied on the premium amount.
Specifies whether the amount of Tax calculated is to be added to or subtracted from the premium amount to be paid to the customer's account.

M (minus) or P (plus). (Input Disallowed) Examples: 1) Assume Credit Interest of 100 and a Tax Rate of 15%. a) Assume Tax Operand P (plus). (net interest rate quoted to the customer) Credit Customer 100 Credit Tax 15 Debit P & L 115 b) Assume Tax Operand M (minus). (gross interest rate quoted to the customer) Credit Customer 85 Credit Tax 15 Debit P & L 100
Currency in which the premium will be paid, in other words the currency of the account.
